In some cases, the interruption of pregnancy should be considered, even before fetal viability is achieved, seeking to improve the mother’s clinical condition, considering that there is evidence showing rapid recovery of maternal oxygenation after the procedure
28- 29, 31 ). Any decision by the health staff should consider the mother’s and family’s principles and desires, without disregarding ethical principles ( 31) . These precepts are endorsed by the International Confederation of Midwives, which reinforce the need of women and fetuses to be treated with dignity, compassion, and respect ( 46) .
